name: Saint Kitts and Nevis
description: Saint Kitts and Nevis is a twin-island nation in the Leeward Islands of the Caribbean. Known for its stunning natural beauty, rich history, and vibrant culture, it offers a unique blend of relaxation, adventure, and cultural experiences. The islands boast lush rainforests, volcanic peaks, pristine beaches, and a fascinating colonial past.

quickFacts.label: Capital
quickFacts.description: The bustling capital city of Saint Kitts and Nevis.
quickFacts.detail: Located on the western coast of St. Kitts, Basseterre is the political, economic, and cultural center of the nation.

quickFacts.label: Population
quickFacts.description: A small, welcoming nation with a strong sense of community.
quickFacts.detail: The population is primarily of African descent, with a significant European influence.

quickFacts.label: Area
quickFacts.description: Two islands combined, offering diverse landscapes.
quickFacts.detail: St. Kitts is larger, while Nevis is smaller and more laid-back.

quickFacts.label: Currency
quickFacts.description: The official currency of Saint Kitts and Nevis.
quickFacts.detail: The XCD is pegged to the US dollar at a rate of 1:1.

quickFacts.label: Official Language
quickFacts.description: English is the official language and is widely spoken.
quickFacts.detail: Creole languages are also spoken throughout the islands.

quickFacts.label: Independence
quickFacts.detail: The islands were formerly part of the Leeward Islands federation.

climateData.title: Tropical Climate
climateData.description: Saint Kitts and Nevis enjoys a tropical climate with consistently warm temperatures and high humidity throughout the year. Rainfall is distributed relatively evenly, with a slightly wetter season.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Summer (June - August)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: The hottest and most humid months, with frequent showers.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Autumn (September - November)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: A transitional season with decreasing rainfall and pleasant temperatures.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Winter (December - February)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: The coolest and driest months, with comfortable temperatures.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Spring (March - May)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Temperatures begin to rise again, and rainfall increases slightly.

naturalWonders.name: Mount Liamuiga
naturalWonders.description: Mount Liamuiga is the dormant volcano dominating St. Kitts. It's the Caribbean's second-highest peak and offers challenging hikes with rewarding panoramic views.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The volcano's crater is a massive depression, and the surrounding area is covered in lush rainforest.  It was once an active volcano, with eruptions in the 18th century.
viewingTips: Check weather conditions before heading out

naturalWonders.name: Nevis Peak
naturalWonders.description: Nevis Peak, the highest point in Saint Kitts and Nevis, offers breathtaking views of the island and surrounding Caribbean Sea.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The peak is covered in cloud forest, home to a diverse array of plant and animal life.  It's a challenging but rewarding climb for experienced hikers.
viewingTips: Be prepared for changing weather conditions

naturalWonders.name: Indian River
naturalWonders.description: The Indian River is a unique mangrove ecosystem, offering a tranquil and scenic experience.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The river is a vital habitat for numerous bird species and other wildlife.  It's a popular spot for boat tours and birdwatching.

ecosystemData.title: Tropical Rainforests and Mangroves
ecosystemData.overview: Saint Kitts and Nevis are dominated by tropical rainforests and mangrove ecosystems, supporting a remarkable biodiversity.
